inputs.selection_motivation: The 10‑year gilt yield is a weaker driver of GBP/USD than the 30‑year gilt; removing it preserves the most relevant long‑term rate link.
inputs.motivation: The 10‑year gilt yield is a weaker driver of GBP/USD than the 30‑year gilt; removing it preserves the most relevant long‑term rate link.

prioritized_link.motivation: GBP/USD movements are closely tied to UK long‑term interest rates; the 30‑year gilt yield captures the long‑term yield curve, so the pair and the yield move together.

llm_raw_response.motivation: The 10‑year gilt yield is a weaker driver of GBP/USD than the 30‑year gilt; removing it preserves the most relevant long‑term rate link.

removal_decision.motivation: The 10‑year gilt yield is a weaker driver of GBP/USD than the 30‑year gilt; removing it preserves the most relevant long‑term rate link.

source_node.query: ((GBPUSD OR GBP/USD OR GBPUSD* OR "GBP/USD" OR "GBPUSD" OR "GBP USD" OR "British Pound" OR "Pound Sterling" OR "Sterling" OR "GBP") AND (USD OR "US Dollar" OR "Dollar" OR "US$" OR "USD$")) AND (exchange rate OR currency OR forex OR FX OR "foreign exchange" OR "currency pair" OR "FX pair") AND (news OR analysis OR trend OR market OR volatility OR movement OR change OR shift OR impact OR report OR update OR outlook OR forecast) AND (inflation OR "interest rate" OR rates OR "central bank" OR "Bank of England" OR BoE OR "BoE policy" OR "BoE rates" OR "BoE decision" OR "BoE meeting" OR Fed OR ECB OR BoJ OR PBoC OR "monetary policy" OR "fiscal policy") AND (economic OR economy OR GDP OR growth OR recession OR recovery)
source_node.name: GBP/USD
